text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu wants another meeting with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat to iron out differences before going to the White House Wednesday to meet President Bill Clinton, an Israeli official said.

Netanyahu adviser David Bar-Illan told Reuters a meeting had been set for some time around 1000 a.m. EDT (1400 GDT) at Blair House, across the street from the White House, "to iron out differences before the big meeting with the president."
Israeli sources said the meeting could long delay the meeting at the White House, which is scheduled for 10:30 a.m. EDT (1430 GDT).

But Palestinian presidential adviser Nabil Abu Rdainah did not immediately confirm the new meeting. "I don't know, not yet," he said when asked about his Israeli counterpart's statement. The two met for only the second time on Tuesday.
A U.S. official told Reuters that "working level officials continued discussions on through the night and are continuing as we speak."
Asked if there was any substantive progress to point to, the official said: "The meetings themselves. The fact that the talks are continuing."
